parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the text label of an existing marker.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>'''Multiplayer optimisation:''' Global marker commands always broadcast the ''entire'' marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).</value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> markerName '''setMarkerText''' text </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> text: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>


</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>"Marker1" [[setMarkerText]] "You are here.";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name/>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>[[setMarkerBrush]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerType]], [[setMarkerAlpha]]
</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>
